intro: Schizocasia acuta var. angustipartita, commonly known as the narrow-lobed spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
